skill.name: geopandas
skill.description: Python library for working with geospatial vector data including shapefiles, GeoJSON, and GeoPackage files. Use when working with geographic data for spatial analysis, geometric operations, coordinate transformations, spatial joins, overlay operations, choropleth mapping, or any task involving reading/writing/analyzing vector geographic data. Supports PostGIS databases, interactive maps, and integration with matplotlib/folium/cartopy. Use for tasks like buffer analysis, spatial joins between datasets, dissolving boundaries, clipping data, calculating areas/distances, reprojecting coordinate systems, creating maps, or converting between spatial file formats.
skill.summary: Python library for working with geospatial vector data including shapefiles, GeoJSON, and GeoPackage...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only Markdown files with educational content about GeoPandas. No executable code, scripts, network operations, or malicious patterns detected.

content.user_title: Work with geospatial vector data for spatial analysis
content.value_statement: Analyzing geographic data requires specialized tools for handling vector geometries, coordinate systems, and spatial relationships. GeoPandas extends pandas to enable spatial operations on geometric types for efficient geospatial data manipulation.
actual_capabilities: Read and write geospatial file formats including Shapefile, GeoJSON, and GeoPackage
Perform spatial joins and overlay operations between datasets
Apply geometric operations such as buffer, simplify, and centroid calculations
Manage coordinate reference systems and reproject data between CRS formats
Create static and interactive maps with matplotlib and folium integration
Calculate areas, distances, and perform spatial queries on geographic data
limitations: Does not handle raster data (use rasterio or GDAL for pixel-based geospatial data)
Performance scales with data size and spatial complexity (use filtering and Arrow acceleration)
Requires understanding of coordinate reference systems for accurate measurements

use_cases.title: Analyze geographic patterns
use_cases.description: Load census data, perform spatial joins with point-of-interest data, and identify geographic trends.

use_cases.title: Process municipal boundaries
use_cases.description: Clip zoning data, dissolve administrative boundaries, and calculate land use statistics.

use_cases.title: Study habitat overlap
use_cases.description: Combine species observation points with protected area polygons to analyze habitat coverage.

prompt_templates.title: Load and explore data
prompt_templates.prompt: Load a shapefile with geopandas and show the first rows, CRS, and geometry types.

prompt_templates.title: Spatial join
prompt_templates.prompt: Join point data to polygon boundaries using a spatial join where points fall within polygons.

prompt_templates.title: Buffer analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a 500-meter buffer around roads and find which parcels intersect with the buffered zones.

prompt_templates.title: Full workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Load GeoJSON data, reproject to appropriate CRS, calculate area, perform buffer operation, and export results to GeoPackage with Arrow acceleration.

output_examples.input: Load a shapefile with building footprints and show the data structure

best_practices: Always check CRS before spatial operations and reproject to projected CRS for accurate area and distance calculations
Use the bbox parameter during file reading to load only data within your area of interest
Validate geometries with .is_valid before performing spatial operations
anti_patterns: Calculating area or distance in geographic CRS (degrees) without first reprojecting to projected CRS
Performing spatial joins without ensuring both datasets use matching coordinate reference systems
Ignoring geometry validity issues before overlay or buffer operations

faq.question: What geospatial file formats are supported?
faq.answer: GeoPandas reads Shapefile, GeoJSON, GeoPackage (GPKG), KML, Parquet, Feather, and PostGIS databases. Use Arrow for 2-4x faster I/O.

faq.question: How large datasets can GeoPandas handle?
faq.answer: Performance depends on spatial complexity. Use bbox filtering during read, spatial indexing, and Arrow acceleration for large datasets.

faq.question: Does it integrate with database systems?
faq.answer: Yes, GeoPandas supports reading and writing to PostGIS using SQLAlchemy and geoalchemy2. Other databases via pandas database connectors.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This is a documentation skill that provides guidance. All data operations run locally with your chosen libraries. No external data transmission occurs.

faq.question: Why are my area calculations returning large numbers?
faq.answer: Area is calculated in CRS units. Geographic CRS (EPSG:4326) returns square degrees which are meaningless. Reproject to UTM or equal-area projection first.

faq.question: How does GeoPandas compare to other GIS tools?
faq.answer: GeoPandas brings pandas-style operations to geospatial data. For raster processing, use rasterio. For full GIS functionality, use QGIS or ArcGIS.
